comment: This is generated by ESQL's AbstractFunctionTestCase. Do no edit it. See ../README.md for how to regenerate it.
name: st_dwithin
description:
Returns whether two geometries are within a specified distance of each other.
For cartesian geometries, this is the pythagorean distance in the same units as the original coordinates.
For geographic geometries, this is the circular distance along the great circle in meters.

params.name: geomA
params.description: Expression of type `geo_point` or `cartesian_point`. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: geomB
params.description: Expression of type `geo_point` or `cartesian_point`. If `null`, the function returns `null`. The second parameter must also have the same coordinate system as the first. This means it is not possible to combine `geo_point` and `cartesian_point` parameters.

params.name: distance
params.description: The distance in meters for geographic geometries or the distance in the same units as the original coordinates for cartesian geometries. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: geomA
params.description: Expression of type `geo_point` or `cartesian_point`. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

params.name: geomB
params.description: Expression of type `geo_point` or `cartesian_point`. If `null`, the function returns `null`. The second parameter must also have the same coordinate system as the first. This means it is not possible to combine `geo_point` and `cartesian_point` parameters.

params.name: distance
params.description: The distance in meters for geographic geometries or the distance in the same units as the original coordinates for cartesian geometries. If `null`, the function returns `null`.

examples:
FROM airports
| WHERE ST_DWITHIN(location, TO_GEOPOINT("POINT(12.565 55.673)"), 500000.0)
| STATS count=COUNT() BY country
| SORT count DESC, country ASC
